intro: Centropogon quitensis, commonly known as the Peruvian lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes over 20,000 species of orchids. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring cool and moist conditions. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, Centropogon quitensis is considered a vulnerable species.
